External Hard Drives: Another option is to use external hard drives that can be connected to a computer or other device. These can be used to store large amounts of data and can be easily transported.

Cloud Storage: Cloud storage services such as Google Drive, Dropbox, and iCloud can be used to store information. These services allow users to store and access data from anywhere with an internet connection.
Tape Backup: Tape backup systems can be used to store large amounts of data. These systems use magnetic tape to store data and can be accessed using specialized equipment.

Optical Storage: Optical storage systems such as holographic storage can be used to store information. These systems use lasers to record data on holographic media, which can be accessed using specialized equipment.
DNA Storage: DNA storage is a new technology that uses DNA molecules to store information. This method is highly stable and can store large amounts of data.
